channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Biden names Karine Jean-Pierre as new White House press secretary
item.description: Jean-Pierre will become first Black woman to hold key post when Jen Psaki leaves White House next week.

item.title: Ukraine’s plight could be replicated in East Asia: Japanese PM
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said now is the time for unity in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: How Mali’s military fell out with its French ally
item.description: French forces are pulling out of Mali after a breakdown in relations with the country's military government.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine live news: UN warns of ‘limitless’ global harm
item.description: Antonio Guterres tells UN Security Council world must unite to end 'cycle of destruction, dislocation and disruption'.

item.title: Otoniel shipped ‘outrageous’ amounts of cocaine to US: Prosecutor
item.description: Accused Colombian drug trafficker pleads not guilty to two charges after being extradited to the US from Bogota.

item.title: Three killed, four wounded in attack near Tel Aviv, medics say
item.description: Security forces set up roadblocks in the area where the killings occurred in the town of Elad.

item.title: Bank of England raises key rate to highest level in 13 years
item.description: The central bank hiked rates for the fourth time since December as UK inflation runs at 30-year highs.

item.title: Israel’s PM says Putin has apologised for Lavrov’s Hitler remarks
item.description: Bennett thanked Putin for clarifying his attitude towards the Jewish people and the memory of the Holocaust.

item.title: US stocks fall as Fed quagmire grips investors
item.description: The S&P 500 fell 3.5%, the Nasdaq 100 shed 5.1% while the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 3.1%.

item.title: Can gang warfare in El Salvador be defeated?
item.description: The government has imposed a state of emergency to curb fighting between rival gangs.

item.title: US Senate will vote on abortion bill next week, Schumer says
item.description: Senate majority leader says vote on bill asserting legality of abortion will show where Republicans stand on the issue.

item.title: Rights groups slam Israeli ruling that allows razing of villages
item.description: Israel's top court rejects petition against the expulsion of Palestinian residents from villages in the West Bank.

item.title: Bitcoin drops by most in almost a month as Fed optimism fades
item.description: The largest digital currency fell as much as 8.4% to $36,639, the biggest intraday drop since April 11.

item.title: US, Canada commemorate missing and murdered Indigenous women
item.description: Indigenous women and girls face disproportionate rates of violence in both countries and advocates say action is needed.

item.title: Al Jazeera wins two Amnesty Media awards
item.description: I-Unit wins for investigation into Bangladesh state corruption; AJ English wins for report on rape as weapon of war.

item.title: US: Walgreens reaches $683m opioid settlement with Florida
item.description: Pharmacy chains have increasingly been targeted for allegedly lax oversight states say spurred high rates of addiction.

item.title: Kurdish refugee nominated for top Australian art prize
item.description: Mostafa Azimitabar painted using a toothbrush while he was held for eight years in Australia's immigration system.

item.title: The Kremlin blinks first in the geo-economic war over Ukraine
item.description: Russia avoided sovereign default, but at a high cost.

item.title: Death toll rises to 26 in central China building collapse
item.description: State media reports a tenth survivor has been pulled from the rubble nearly a week after incident in Changsha.

item.title: WHO puts global COVID-19 death toll at nearly 15 million
item.description: New report by UN health agency says coronavirus pandemic killed nearly three times more people than officially reported.

item.title: Thousands sickened, one dead as latest severe sandstorm hits Iraq
item.description: Residents of six of Iraq's 18 provinces, including Baghdad and Al-Anbar, hit by thick clouds of choking dust.

item.title: ‘They killed everything’: Darfur survivor recounts deadly attack
item.description: Despite a peace deal signed in 2020, a military coup in Sudan last year has brought back instability in the region.

item.title: Australia PM urges calm as Solomons leader cites ‘invasion’ claim
item.description: Tensions have risen since the Solomon Islands signed a security deal with China amid protests by Australia and the US.

item.title: Musk gets extra $7bn for Twitter bid from tech heavyweights
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk has strengthened the equity stake of his offer to buy Twitter.

item.title: Oil climbs to highest since March as US eyes crude purchases
item.description: West Texas Intermediate jumped more than 3 percent to surpass $111.
